page.title: 12THE VILLAGE DOCTOR
page.content:
"In St.Margaret's" said Dr.Thomson "people are very healthy and I seldom have to send people to hospital with serious illnesses." He then told us that the most serious illnesses were heart attacks and strokes but he only had to deal with 2 to 3 cases a week.
"To become a doctor," said Dr. Thomsom,"took 6 years of training." He told us that before he came to the village he had worked in Dover and before that he had been a medical officer in the Sudan.
He owns the surgery and said that if he stopped being a doctor he would make the surgery into a house. . Dr.Thomson said that he loved his work in spite of the long hours and that he would never like to change.
